page.title: 04Survey of Great Shelford
page.content: We asked people questions about themselves and their village. One of these questions was 'What improvements would you like to see ?' In reply to this, people seemed satisfied with the village as it was. 'Where did they shop ?' Most of those questioned shopped in Cambridge, because as they were in Cambridge sometimes up to five times a week, they did their shopping then. Some people said they only used the village shops for buying small items. Another question was 'How did they get around town ?', most of the people questions replied that they had cars but old people said they walked and rarely left the village.
